diagnosis.final_diagnosis: bipolar II disorder; attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, combined presentation; other specified schizophrenia spectrum and other psychotic disorder: attenuated psychosis syndrome
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: bipolar disorder with psychotic features, substance use disorder, posttraumatic stress disorder, anxiety disorder, schizophreniform disorder, schizoaffective disorder
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Aaron presented with subsyndromal psychotic symptoms, such as unusual thought content and delusional beliefs, alongside a history of mood instability and significant psychosocial stressors. His symptoms were evaluated using structured clinical interviews, indicating high risk for psychosis without complete loss of reality testing, which were foundational to diagnosing attenuated psychosis syndrome.
